long_description.last_approved_text: Although those who serve the Will of Heaven will strive tirelessly, it is not through this effort that the Yellow Sky will rise. Rather, it is the inevitable that will see the old ways fall. Those who serve the Will of Heaven must be patient, yet certain of their purpose, and they will surely see their victory.

technologies.long_description: Although those who serve the Will of Heaven will strive tirelessly, it is not through this effort that the Yellow Sky will rise. Rather, it is the inevitable that will see the old ways fall. Those who serve the Will of Heaven must be patient, yet certain of their purpose, and they will surely see their victory.

short_description.last_approved_text: The Heavenly Reason does not quarrel, but it is sure to conquer. It speaks not, but it is sure to respond. It summons not, but attracts men naturally. It works patiently, but is sure in its designs.

technologies.short_description: The Heavenly Reason does not quarrel, but it is sure to conquer. It speaks not, but it is sure to respond. It summons not, but attracts men naturally. It works patiently, but is sure in its designs.

long_description.last_approved_text: Simplicity is the basis for all things. One must know, or learn, to be simple before he can be complex. Only those who understand simplicity are just and righteous leaders - through guiding principles grounded in wisdom and simplicity, only good can come.

technologies.long_description: Simplicity is the basis for all things. One must know, or learn, to be simple before he can be complex. Only those who understand simplicity are just and righteous leaders - through guiding principles grounded in wisdom and simplicity, only good can come.

short_description.last_approved_text: Simplicity, when scattered, becomes a vessel of usefulness. The holy man, by using it, becomes the chief leader; and truly, a great principle will never do harm.

technologies.short_description: Simplicity, when scattered, becomes a vessel of usefulness. The holy man, by using it, becomes the chief leader; and truly, a great principle will never do harm.

long_description.last_approved_text: From the cradle the righteous are born strong, ready to cry out in the name of justice and fight despite their ignorance. They are guided by heaven, and although their flesh and bone may be weak, they are driven by a much stronger purpose - and this purpose is impervious to harm!

technologies.long_description: From the cradle the righteous are born strong, ready to cry out in the name of justice and fight despite their ignorance. They are guided by heaven, and although their flesh and bone may be weak, they are driven by a much stronger purpose - and this purpose is impervious to harm!

short_description.last_approved_text: Venomous reptiles do not sting him, fierce beasts do not seize him. Birds of prey do not strike him. His bones are weak, his sinews tender, but his grasp is firm.

technologies.short_description: Venomous reptiles do not sting him, fierce beasts do not seize him. Birds of prey do not strike him. His bones are weak, his sinews tender, but his grasp is firm.

long_description.last_approved_text: The nature of goodness is that it is indiscriminate. The righteous must be kind to both friend and foe alike; this is the essence of harmony. Yet when the harmony of all is threatened by the corruption of the powerful, virtue dictates that action must be swift, decisive and, if necessary, merciless.

technologies.long_description: The nature of goodness is that it is indiscriminate. The righteous must be kind to both friend and foe alike; this is the essence of harmony. Yet when the harmony of all is threatened by the corruption of the powerful, virtue dictates that action must be swift, decisive and, if necessary, merciless.

short_description.last_approved_text: The good I meet with goodness; the bad I also meet with goodness; that is virtue's goodness. The faithful I meet with faith; the faithless I also meet with faith; that is virtue's faith.

technologies.short_description: The good I meet with goodness; the bad I also meet with goodness; that is virtue's goodness. The faithful I meet with faith; the faithless I also meet with faith; that is virtue's faith.

long_description.last_approved_text: The people cannot be blamed for lashing out when their conditions are so harsh and oppressive. Any man is only as good as the one who leads him, and so the panacea to the people's woes is to fix problems at the top of the hierarchy. The cause must be treated, then the symptoms will follow.

technologies.long_description: The people cannot be blamed for lashing out when their conditions are so harsh and oppressive. Any man is only as good as the one who leads him, and so the panacea to the people's woes is to fix problems at the top of the hierarchy. The cause must be treated, then the symptoms will follow.

short_description.last_approved_text: The people hunger because their superiors consume too many taxes; therefore they hunger. The people are difficult to govern because their superiors are too meddlesome; therefore they are difficult to govern.

technologies.short_description: The people hunger because their superiors consume too many taxes; therefore they hunger. The people are difficult to govern because their superiors are too meddlesome; therefore they are difficult to govern.

long_description.last_approved_text: Only those who do not understand the Way of Great Peace ridicule it, and those who do not understand the Way are themselves inferior both in reason and in logic. Those who do not ridicule the Way are enlightened and righteous, and strive for harmony. They will see our vision realised!

technologies.long_description: Only those who do not understand the Way of Great Peace ridicule it, and those who do not understand the Way are themselves inferior both in reason and in logic. Those who do not ridicule the Way are enlightened and righteous, and strive for harmony. They will see our vision realised!

short_description.last_approved_text: When an inferior scholar hears of Reason he will greatly ridicule it. Were it not thus ridiculed, it would as Reason be insufficient.

technologies.short_description: When an inferior scholar hears of Reason he will greatly ridicule it. Were it not thus ridiculed, it would as Reason be insufficient.

long_description.last_approved_text: To rule justly and greatly, one must not impact the lives of the populace, only aid them unseen. The ruler who is known is often detested, for they are associated with unpopular policies and suffering. Wise and judicious rule is done without self-glorification; this is true leadership.

technologies.long_description: To rule justly and greatly, one must not impact the lives of the populace, only aid them unseen. The ruler who is known is often detested, for they are associated with unpopular policies and suffering. Wise and judicious rule is done without self-glorification; this is true leadership.

short_description.last_approved_text: Of great rulers the subjects do not notice the existence. To lesser ones people are attached; they praise them. Still lesser ones people fear, and the meanest ones people despise.

technologies.short_description: Of great rulers the subjects do not notice the existence. To lesser ones people are attached; they praise them. Still lesser ones people fear, and the meanest ones people despise.

long_description.last_approved_text: The strength of the Tao lies in its purpose - to restore harmony. The righteous who raise the banner of the Yellow Turbans and fight in its name lift up those lacking the strength to do so, whilst tearing down an overabundance of power. Harmony is achieved by bringing everyone to the same level and defeating those who refuse this earnest calling.

technologies.long_description: The strength of the Tao lies in its purpose - to restore harmony. The righteous who raise the banner of the Yellow Turbans and fight in its name lift up those lacking the strength to do so, whilst tearing down an overabundance of power. Harmony is achieved by bringing everyone to the same level and defeating those who refuse this earnest calling.

short_description.last_approved_text: Is not Heaven's Reason truly like stretching a bow? The high it brings down, the lowly it lifts up. Those who have abundance it depletes; those who are deficient it augments.

technologies.short_description: Is not Heaven's Reason truly like stretching a bow? The high it brings down, the lowly it lifts up. Those who have abundance it depletes; those who are deficient it augments.

long_description.last_approved_text: Material wealth is not true wealth, as decadence and opulent behaviour are not true happiness. True happiness, to those who follow the true Tao, is in helping others and protecting those most in need of protection. This way lies true happiness; this way lies true harmony.

technologies.long_description: Material wealth is not true wealth, as decadence and opulent behaviour are not true happiness. True happiness, to those who follow the true Tao, is in helping others and protecting those most in need of protection. This way lies true happiness; this way lies true harmony.

short_description.last_approved_text: The holy man hoards not. The more he does for others, the more he owns himself. The more he gives to others, the more will he himself lay up an abundance.

technologies.short_description: The holy man hoards not. The more he does for others, the more he owns himself. The more he gives to others, the more will he himself lay up an abundance.

long_description.last_approved_text: Strength is like water - it is not beholden to the conventionally 'mighty'. Water flows and moulds; yes, it is weak, but also enduring. Pliable water wears down the mightiest rock and douses the most furious fire. The might and vastness of water is the might and vastness of the people, who will rise up to overwhelm the decadent and the corrupt.

technologies.long_description: Strength is like water - it is not beholden to the conventionally 'mighty'. Water flows and moulds; yes, it is weak, but also enduring. Pliable water wears down the mightiest rock and douses the most furious fire. The might and vastness of water is the might and vastness of the people, who will rise up to overwhelm the decadent and the corrupt.

short_description.last_approved_text: The weak conquer the strong, the tender conquer the rigid. In the world there is no one who does not know it, but no one will practise it.

technologies.short_description: The weak conquer the strong, the tender conquer the rigid. In the world there is no one who does not know it, but no one will practise it.

long_description.last_approved_text: True knowledge is born out of an understanding of the unchangeable rule of the universe - that everything grows and develops before returning to its original state - a state of tranquillity. Knowing this gives the righteous a noble purpose, and this purpose endures like the very heavens.

technologies.long_description: True knowledge is born out of an understanding of the unchangeable rule of the universe - that everything grows and develops before returning to its original state - a state of tranquillity. Knowing this gives the righteous a noble purpose, and this purpose endures like the very heavens.

short_description.last_approved_text: Knowing eternity makes one comprehensive; comprehension makes one broadminded; breadth of vision brings nobility; nobility is like heaven.The heavenly is like Dao. Dao is the Eternal. The decay of the body is not to be feared

technologies.short_description: Knowing eternity makes one comprehensive; comprehension makes one broadminded; breadth of vision brings nobility; nobility is like heaven.The heavenly is like Dao. Dao is the Eternal. The decay of the body is not to be feared

long_description.last_approved_text: Flamboyance, and extravagances are born of an abundance of pride and vanity. This decadence is not good for earth, and not good for heaven. Such hedonisms must be excised, as surely as light must follow dark, and dark must follow light. China's salvation can only come through the total purge of such useless excess.

technologies.long_description: Flamboyance, and extravagances are born of an abundance of pride and vanity. This decadence is not good for earth, and not good for heaven. Such hedonisms must be excised, as surely as light must follow dark, and dark must follow light. China's salvation can only come through the total purge of such useless excess.

short_description.last_approved_text: To wear ornaments and ostentatious clothes, to carry sharp swords, to be excessive in drinking and eating, to have a redundance of costly articles, this is the pride of robbers.

technologies.short_description: To wear ornaments and ostentatious clothes, to carry sharp swords, to be excessive in drinking and eating, to have a redundance of costly articles, this is the pride of robbers.

long_description.last_approved_text: An open, abstract mind is the apex of understanding - when one can think rationally, but leave room for infinite possibility, then they have truly found harmony. A closed mind is the Way of Ignorance, and from ignorance spurns greed, corruption and, ultimately, chaos.

technologies.long_description: An open, abstract mind is the apex of understanding - when one can think rationally, but leave room for infinite possibility, then they have truly found harmony. A closed mind is the Way of Ignorance, and from ignorance spurns greed, corruption and, ultimately, chaos.

short_description.last_approved_text: By attaining the height of abstraction we gain fulness of rest.

technologies.short_description: By attaining the height of abstraction we gain fulness of rest.

long_description.last_approved_text: The greater ideal should always be to master yourself. Only once you have achieved an internal harmony, can you externalise it. To know others, to defeat others, to conquer others and to save others - these things can only be achieved when you know yourself, your limits, mortality and ultimately, your greater purpose.

technologies.long_description: The greater ideal should always be to master yourself. Only once you have achieved an internal harmony, can you externalise it. To know others, to defeat others, to conquer others and to save others - these things can only be achieved when you know yourself, your limits, mortality and ultimately, your greater purpose.

short_description.last_approved_text: Knowing others is wisdom; Knowing the self is enlightenment. Mastering others requires force; Mastering the self requires strength; He who knows he has enough is rich. Perseverance is a sign of will power. He who stays where he is, endures. To die but not to perish is to be eternally present.

technologies.short_description: Knowing others is wisdom; Knowing the self is enlightenment. Mastering others requires force; Mastering the self requires strength; He who knows he has enough is rich. Perseverance is a sign of will power. He who stays where he is, endures. To die but not to perish is to be eternally present.

long_description.last_approved_text: Goodness, and beauty should not be performative - acts of generosity and kindness should be done for their own sake. If they become ostentatious or obvious displays, clearly designed to attract attention to your deeds, then they are not good deeds at all, but dark deeds revealing only the corruption of your soul.

technologies.long_description: Goodness, and beauty should not be performative - acts of generosity and kindness should be done for their own sake. If they become ostentatious or obvious displays, clearly designed to attract attention to your deeds, then they are not good deeds at all, but dark deeds revealing only the corruption of your soul.

short_description.last_approved_text: Everywhere it is obvious that if beauty makes a display of beauty, it is sheer ugliness. It is obvious that if goodness makes a display of goodness, it is sheer badness.

technologies.short_description: Everywhere it is obvious that if beauty makes a display of beauty, it is sheer ugliness. It is obvious that if goodness makes a display of goodness, it is sheer badness.

long_description.last_approved_text: It is resolve - forthright and strong - that will lead the Yellow Turbans to ultimate victory. Conviction, tempered by modesty and an earnest sense of justice, will push through the chaos and set China free from its current misery. The Tao preaches non-violence, but for the unjust to be purged, there is no alternative.

technologies.long_description: It is resolve - forthright and strong - that will lead the Yellow Turbans to ultimate victory. Conviction, tempered by modesty and an earnest sense of justice, will push through the chaos and set China free from its current misery. The Tao preaches non-violence, but for the unjust to be purged, there is no alternative.

short_description.last_approved_text: Be resolute but not boastful; resolute but not haughty; resolute but not arrogant; resolute because you cannot avoid it; resolute but not violent.

technologies.short_description: Be resolute but not boastful; resolute but not haughty; resolute but not arrogant; resolute because you cannot avoid it; resolute but not violent.

long_description.last_approved_text: Those who follow the Tao, and devote themselves to reason and understanding, will themselves become men of reason and understanding, whilst those who seek corruption will be corrupted. The who see the reasonable and the uncorrupted will agree with them, even if they themselves are affected be corruption and dark thoughts.

technologies.long_description: Those who follow the Tao, and devote themselves to reason and understanding, will themselves become men of reason and understanding, whilst those who seek corruption will be corrupted. The who see the reasonable and the uncorrupted will agree with them, even if they themselves are affected be corruption and dark thoughts.

short_description.last_approved_text: Those who pursue their business in Reason, men of Reason, associate in Reason. Those who pursue their business in virtue associate in virtue. Those who pursue their business in ill luck associate in ill luck. When men associate in Reason, Reason makes them glad to find companions.

technologies.short_description: Those who pursue their business in Reason, men of Reason, associate in Reason. Those who pursue their business in virtue associate in virtue. Those who pursue their business in ill luck associate in ill luck. When men associate in Reason, Reason makes them glad to find companions.

long_description.last_approved_text: To be true and righteous, one cannot always be kind. The truth, as is often stated, hurts, but only through blunt action can harmony be restored. There is no grace in this harshness, but there is necessity - through this hard and earnest talk and action will China finally be redeemed.

technologies.long_description: To be true and righteous, one cannot always be kind. The truth, as is often stated, hurts, but only through blunt action can harmony be restored. There is no grace in this harshness, but there is necessity - through this hard and earnest talk and action will China finally be redeemed.

short_description.last_approved_text: True words are not pleasant; pleasant words are not true. The good are not contentious; the contentious are not good. The wise are not learned; the learned are not wise.

technologies.short_description: True words are not pleasant; pleasant words are not true. The good are not contentious; the contentious are not good. The wise are not learned; the learned are not wise.

long_description.last_approved_text: The reality of the Tao, and of spirituality, can be vexing and uncomfortable to people, whilst worldly pleasures are more entertaining. Yet earthly delights are but passing fancies - true spirituality is born of the uncomfortable realisations that lead us to true understanding.

technologies.long_description: The reality of the Tao, and of spirituality, can be vexing and uncomfortable to people, whilst worldly pleasures are more entertaining. Yet earthly delights are but passing fancies - true spirituality is born of the uncomfortable realisations that lead us to true understanding.

short_description.last_approved_text: Music with dainties makes the passing stranger stop. But Reason, when coming from the mouth, how tasteless is it! It has no flavour. When looked at, there is not enough to be seen; when listened to, there is not enough to be heard. However, when used, it is inexhaustible.

technologies.short_description: Music with dainties makes the passing stranger stop. But Reason, when coming from the mouth, how tasteless is it! It has no flavour. When looked at, there is not enough to be seen; when listened to, there is not enough to be heard. However, when used, it is inexhaustible.

long_description.last_approved_text: Calmness, rationality and thoughtfulness are the keys to understanding the Tao and finding harmony. To over speak is to be boastful and overwrought, whilst to amass fortune is greedy and corrupt. You should always be creating for others, that they may be better. Your deeds may never been seen, as wealth is, but instead be understood by those it touches.

technologies.long_description: Calmness, rationality and thoughtfulness are the keys to understanding the Tao and finding harmony. To over speak is to be boastful and overwrought, whilst to amass fortune is greedy and corrupt. You should always be creating for others, that they may be better. Your deeds may never been seen, as wealth is, but instead be understood by those it touches.

short_description.last_approved_text: The holy man abides by non-assertion in his affairs and conveys by silence his instruction. When the ten thousand things arise, verily, he refuses them not. He quickens but owns not. He acts but claims not. Merit he accomplishes, but he does not dwell on it. Since he does not dwell on it, it will never leave him.

technologies.short_description: The holy man abides by non-assertion in his affairs and conveys by silence his instruction. When the ten thousand things arise, verily, he refuses them not. He quickens but owns not. He acts but claims not. Merit he accomplishes, but he does not dwell on it. Since he does not dwell on it, it will never leave him.

long_description.last_approved_text: A daunting task must still be done, despite how difficult it appears at first. Yet where to begin? With the smallest part of it? It matters not - what matters is that you begin at all, taking the first step on the journey that may take many months or years, and see that journey through to the end.

technologies.long_description: A daunting task must still be done, despite how difficult it appears at first. Yet where to begin? With the smallest part of it? It matters not - what matters is that you begin at all, taking the first step on the journey that may take many months or years, and see that journey through to the end.

short_description.last_approved_text: A thousand miles' journey begins with a foot.

technologies.short_description: A thousand miles' journey begins with a foot.

long_description.last_approved_text: There is no shame nor judgement in feeling content - yet an overabundance of wealth or possessions will cause great disharmony in the people - jealousy, anger; these things stem from discontent at those who hoard, particularly at the expense of the less fortunate. Those who learn to moderate, and be happy with what they have, will fear no repercussions, and will be in harmony with their neighbours.

technologies.long_description: There is no shame nor judgement in feeling content - yet an overabundance of wealth or possessions will cause great disharmony in the people - jealousy, anger; these things stem from discontent at those who hoard, particularly at the expense of the less fortunate. Those who learn to moderate, and be happy with what they have, will fear no repercussions, and will be in harmony with their neighbours.

short_description.last_approved_text: Extreme indulgence leads to squander. Hoarded wealth invites plundering.

technologies.short_description: Extreme indulgence leads to squander. Hoarded wealth invites plundering.

long_description.last_approved_text: To rule and to teach one must be moderate, not extreme, for when extremities become the new normal, anything different is eyed with suspicion and distrust, and this cannot be so. When a government is unassuming and direct, so too will its people be, and when they pry or nose too intensely, the people too will also become overbearing. This must be avoided.

technologies.long_description: To rule and to teach one must be moderate, not extreme, for when extremities become the new normal, anything different is eyed with suspicion and distrust, and this cannot be so. When a government is unassuming and direct, so too will its people be, and when they pry or nose too intensely, the people too will also become overbearing. This must be avoided.

short_description.last_approved_text: The holy man is square but not sharp, strict but not obnoxious, upright but not restraining, bright but not dazzling.

technologies.short_description: The holy man is square but not sharp, strict but not obnoxious, upright but not restraining, bright but not dazzling.

long_description.last_approved_text: The Tao is wide and all-encompassing, but no detail escapes its gaze. It is patient and considered, and those who follow it must be also patient and considered. To conquer, one must not strive for conquest, but instead for reason. Only through this patience and good intent will enemies be defeated and harmony prevail.

technologies.long_description: The Tao is wide and all-encompassing, but no detail escapes its gaze. It is patient and considered, and those who follow it must be also patient and considered. To conquer, one must not strive for conquest, but instead for reason. Only through this patience and good intent will enemies be defeated and harmony prevail.

short_description.last_approved_text: Heaven's net is vast, so vast. It is wide-meshed, but it loses nothing.

technologies.short_description: Heaven's net is vast, so vast. It is wide-meshed, but it loses nothing.

long_description.last_approved_text: If we have peace and let the Tao prevail over the land, there will be no such need for 'war' horses, which can then be returned to the field to pasture. It is only from necessity that objects of war are created - it is in all our interests to reduce ourselves to a simple, peaceful state, and to return our thinking to that state also.

technologies.long_description: If we have peace and let the Tao prevail over the land, there will be no such need for 'war' horses, which can then be returned to the field to pasture. It is only from necessity that objects of war are created - it is in all our interests to reduce ourselves to a simple, peaceful state, and to return our thinking to that state also.

short_description.last_approved_text: When the world possesses Reason, race horses are reserved for hauling dung. When the world is without Reason, war horses are bred in the common.

technologies.short_description: When the world possesses Reason, race horses are reserved for hauling dung. When the world is without Reason, war horses are bred in the common.

long_description.last_approved_text: The excesses of the nobility will always be felt by the common folk - their wealth and prosperity is drained so that the higher classes can have decadence beyond their needs. Only when everyone receives what they need, will our realm and our people know harmony and peace.

technologies.long_description: The excesses of the nobility will always be felt by the common folk - their wealth and prosperity is drained so that the higher classes can have decadence beyond their needs. Only when everyone receives what they need, will our realm and our people know harmony and peace.

short_description.last_approved_text: When the palace is very splendid, the fields are very weedy and granaries very empty.

technologies.short_description: When the palace is very splendid, the fields are very weedy and granaries very empty.

long_description.last_approved_text: A good leader, following the Tao, should not be reactive to problems as they occur, but pro-actively attempting to treat potential issues before they arise. Disorder cannot be the impetus that spurs one to action, rather the implementation of measures that will stop the problems from ever occurring.

technologies.long_description: A good leader, following the Tao, should not be reactive to problems as they occur, but pro-actively attempting to treat potential issues before they arise. Disorder cannot be the impetus that spurs one to action, rather the implementation of measures that will stop the problems from ever occurring.

short_description.last_approved_text: Treat things before they exist. Regulate things before disorder begins.

technologies.short_description: Treat things before they exist. Regulate things before disorder begins.

long_description.last_approved_text: We must find righteous leaders to follow, but never idolise, for to idolise the extraordinary is to invite avarice and jealousy, and in doing so poison our hearts. It is in the normality of the peasant - the farmer - that we must establish our ideals and our role models. It is the ordinary that ploughs the land and provides for us, the ordinary that forges the sword and the ordinary that wields it. In doing so, these ordinary people become extraordinary.

technologies.long_description: We must find righteous leaders to follow, but never idolise, for to idolise the extraordinary is to invite avarice and jealousy, and in doing so poison our hearts. It is in the normality of the peasant - the farmer - that we must establish our ideals and our role models. It is the ordinary that ploughs the land and provides for us, the ordinary that forges the sword and the ordinary that wields it. In doing so, these ordinary people become extraordinary.

short_description.last_approved_text: All in the world call me great; but I resemble the unlikely. Now a man is great only because he resembles the unlikely. Did he resemble the likely, how lasting, indeed, would his mediocrity be!

technologies.short_description: All in the world call me great; but I resemble the unlikely. Now a man is great only because he resembles the unlikely. Did he resemble the likely, how lasting, indeed, would his mediocrity be!

long_description.last_approved_text: The famous and wealthy are only given power by the praise they are showered with. If we do not attempt to emulate the rich, less people will want to steal, and if we do not pastiche the famous, less people will seek glory at the expense of their fellow man. How society glorifies the undeserving defines how that society wishes to grow.

technologies.long_description: The famous and wealthy are only given power by the praise they are showered with. If we do not attempt to emulate the rich, less people will want to steal, and if we do not pastiche the famous, less people will seek glory at the expense of their fellow man. How society glorifies the undeserving defines how that society wishes to grow.

short_description.last_approved_text: Not boasting of one's worth forestalls people's envy. Not prizing treasures difficult to obtain keeps people from committing theft.

technologies.short_description: Not boasting of one's worth forestalls people's envy. Not prizing treasures difficult to obtain keeps people from committing theft.

long_description.last_approved_text: The key to any great nation is to have resources and opportunity available to the people, but them not feel the need to avail themselves of it. Contentment of a people is achieved by the state, which theoretically has total power over them, not using it, but instead facilitating their happiness for the benefit of both the people and the state.

technologies.long_description: The key to any great nation is to have resources and opportunity available to the people, but them not feel the need to avail themselves of it. Contentment of a people is achieved by the state, which theoretically has total power over them, not using it, but instead facilitating their happiness for the benefit of both the people and the state.

short_description.last_approved_text: In a small country with few people let there be aldermen and mayors who are possessed of power over men but would not use it. Induce people to grieve at death but do not cause them to move to a distance. Although they had ships and carriages, they should find no occasion to ride in them. Although they had armours and weapons, they should find no occasion to don them.

technologies.short_description: In a small country with few people let there be aldermen and mayors who are possessed of power over men but would not use it. Induce people to grieve at death but do not cause them to move to a distance. Although they had ships and carriages, they should find no occasion to ride in them. Although they had armours and weapons, they should find no occasion to don them.

long_description.last_approved_text: If we seek self-preservation, born of selfishness, then we will find the opposite: suffering and death. When we put others ahead of ourselves, and seek to lift everyone and not just one, then we will save ourselves through our actions. This is the Way of Heaven, and so too should be the Way of Earth.

technologies.long_description: If we seek self-preservation, born of selfishness, then we will find the opposite: suffering and death. When we put others ahead of ourselves, and seek to lift everyone and not just one, then we will save ourselves through our actions. This is the Way of Heaven, and so too should be the Way of Earth.

short_description.last_approved_text: Heaven endures and earth is lasting. And why can heaven and earth endure and be lasting? Because they do not live for themselves. On that account can they endure.

technologies.short_description: Heaven endures and earth is lasting. And why can heaven and earth endure and be lasting? Because they do not live for themselves. On that account can they endure.

long_description.last_approved_text: All things in balance, and through this order. The ruler who too-heavily favours one way or the other - for instance, brute force - will find their kingdom out of balance, and so invite chaos into proceedings. One must understand that light balances darkness, rest controls motion, and order balances chaos.

technologies.long_description: All things in balance, and through this order. The ruler who too-heavily favours one way or the other - for instance, brute force - will find their kingdom out of balance, and so invite chaos into proceedings. One must understand that light balances darkness, rest controls motion, and order balances chaos.

short_description.last_approved_text: The heavy is the root of the light, and rest is motion's master.

technologies.short_description: The heavy is the root of the light, and rest is motion's master.

long_description.last_approved_text: Greed is the crux of all corruption in the land, from the highest official to the lowliest highway robber. If we eliminate greed from our society, and moreover the need for greed at all, the people will be more at peace. If the needs of the people are accounted for, then they will not look towards other, darker sources to sustain their desires.

technologies.long_description: Greed is the crux of all corruption in the land, from the highest official to the lowliest highway robber. If we eliminate greed from our society, and moreover the need for greed at all, the people will be more at peace. If the needs of the people are accounted for, then they will not look towards other, darker sources to sustain their desires.

short_description.last_approved_text: Abandon smartness; give up greed; and thieves and robbers will no longer exist.

technologies.short_description: Abandon smartness; give up greed; and thieves and robbers will no longer exist.

long_description.last_approved_text: Our path towards harmony should start within us. Only when we have mastered ourselves and the Tao of our own spirit, can we extend it outwards to others. From within, we should see to the harmony of our own house and then our neighbours. In this fashion, it will not be long before all of China - nay, the world - is wrapped in the harmonious understanding of the Tao.

technologies.long_description: Our path towards harmony should start within us. Only when we have mastered ourselves and the Tao of our own spirit, can we extend it outwards to others. From within, we should see to the harmony of our own house and then our neighbours. In this fashion, it will not be long before all of China - nay, the world - is wrapped in the harmonious understanding of the Tao.

short_description.last_approved_text: Who cultivates Reason in his person, his virtue is genuine. Who cultivates it in his house, his virtue is overflowing. Who cultivates it in his township, his virtue is lasting. Who cultivates it in his country, his virtue is abundant. Who cultivates it in the world, his virtue is universal.

technologies.short_description: Who cultivates Reason in his person, his virtue is genuine. Who cultivates it in his house, his virtue is overflowing. Who cultivates it in his township, his virtue is lasting. Who cultivates it in his country, his virtue is abundant. Who cultivates it in the world, his virtue is universal.

long_description.last_approved_text: The virtuous leader is one who does not seek to laud their power over others, but instead uses it to benefit their countrymen. The leader who accumulates power to no end but their own greed is a corrupted leader - one who must be removed if China is to ever know harmony and peace.

technologies.long_description: The virtuous leader is one who does not seek to laud their power over others, but instead uses it to benefit their countrymen. The leader who accumulates power to no end but their own greed is a corrupted leader - one who must be removed if China is to ever know harmony and peace.

short_description.last_approved_text: Who loves the people when administering the country will practise nonassertion. Opening and closing the gates of heaven, he will be like a mother bird; bright, and white, and penetrating the four quarters, he will be unsophisticated. He quickens them and feeds them. He quickens but owns not. He acts but claims not. He excels but rules not. This is called profound virtue.

technologies.short_description: Who loves the people when administering the country will practise nonassertion. Opening and closing the gates of heaven, he will be like a mother bird; bright, and white, and penetrating the four quarters, he will be unsophisticated. He quickens them and feeds them. He quickens but owns not. He acts but claims not. He excels but rules not. This is called profound virtue.

long_description.last_approved_text: The Tao is an eternal force beyond the trappings of the earth - it is the cosmos, connecting heaven and earth together. Thus it is that the wise man, gifted in the Tao's understanding, does not need to travel the world to know it, nor meet all the people to understand them - the Tao has been all the education they will need.

technologies.long_description: The Tao is an eternal force beyond the trappings of the earth - it is the cosmos, connecting heaven and earth together. Thus it is that the wise man, gifted in the Tao's understanding, does not need to travel the world to know it, nor meet all the people to understand them - the Tao has been all the education they will need.

short_description.last_approved_text: The simplicity of the unexpressed will purify the heart of lust. If there is no desire there will be quiet, and all the world will thus be blest.

technologies.short_description: The simplicity of the unexpressed will purify the heart of lust. If there is no desire there will be quiet, and all the world will thus be blest.

long_description.last_approved_text: Those who are unskilled will, inevitably, look to the skilled to teach them. The man who requires string to bind will look to the man who does not. Good men honour those who can teach them and wicked, corrupted men spurn their wisdom and mastery. These corrupted are those who must be targeted.

technologies.long_description: Those who are unskilled will, inevitably, look to the skilled to teach them. The man who requires string to bind will look to the man who does not. Good men honour those who can teach them and wicked, corrupted men spurn their wisdom and mastery. These corrupted are those who must be targeted.

short_description.last_approved_text: Good travellers leave no trace nor track, Good speakers, in logic show no lack, good counters need no counting rack. "Good lockers bolting bars need not, Yet none their locks can loose. Good binders need no string nor knot, Yet none unties their noose.

technologies.short_description: Good travellers leave no trace nor track, Good speakers, in logic show no lack, good counters need no counting rack. "Good lockers bolting bars need not, Yet none their locks can loose. Good binders need no string nor knot, Yet none unties their noose.

long_description.last_approved_text: The key to all things is moderation, especially the ruling of a nation. For the nation to succeed, the leader must know that he can rule without limits, yet impose upon himself a limit - moderation will allow him to govern the people, and to know that is below the Will of Heaven, which drives his purpose.

technologies.long_description: The key to all things is moderation, especially the ruling of a nation. For the nation to succeed, the leader must know that he can rule without limits, yet impose upon himself a limit - moderation will allow him to govern the people, and to know that is below the Will of Heaven, which drives his purpose.

short_description.last_approved_text: To govern the people is the affair of heaven and there is nothing like thrift. Now consider that thrift is said to come from early practice.

technologies.short_description: To govern the people is the affair of heaven and there is nothing like thrift. Now consider that thrift is said to come from early practice.

long_description.last_approved_text: The Tao is internal and guiding, but the ultimate test of its success is how it becomes a household, a neighbourhood, a city, or an empire. Through communal practice, the Tao is tested against itself in others, and through constant study and reassessment, a greater understanding is achieved by all.

technologies.long_description: The Tao is internal and guiding, but the ultimate test of its success is how it becomes a household, a neighbourhood, a city, or an empire. Through communal practice, the Tao is tested against itself in others, and through constant study and reassessment, a greater understanding is achieved by all.

short_description.last_approved_text: By one's person one tests persons. By one's house one tests houses. By one's township one tests townships. By one's country one tests countries. By one's world one tests worlds.

technologies.short_description: By one's person one tests persons. By one's house one tests houses. By one's township one tests townships. By one's country one tests countries. By one's world one tests worlds.

long_description.last_approved_text: Be humble in victory, and gracious in defeat. One should never do more than is required in the pursuit of peace. A true master knows that his mastery is shown in his mercy and patience, not in his overbearing demonstration of skill. The master warrior will fight as much as he needs to, then stop, never advancing a foot or a blow more than is required. He fights because he must; he is a master because he must be, never because he desires it.

technologies.long_description: Be humble in victory, and gracious in defeat. One should never do more than is required in the pursuit of peace. A true master knows that his mastery is shown in his mercy and patience, not in his overbearing demonstration of skill. The master warrior will fight as much as he needs to, then stop, never advancing a foot or a blow more than is required. He fights because he must; he is a master because he must be, never because he desires it.

short_description.last_approved_text: A skilful warrior strikes a decisive blow, and stops. He does not dare to strike again to assert and complete his mastery. He will strike the blow, but will be on his guard against being vain or boastful or arrogant in consequence of it. He strikes it as a matter of necessity; he strikes it, but not from a wish for mastery.

technologies.short_description: A skilful warrior strikes a decisive blow, and stops. He does not dare to strike again to assert and complete his mastery. He will strike the blow, but will be on his guard against being vain or boastful or arrogant in consequence of it. He strikes it as a matter of necessity; he strikes it, but not from a wish for mastery.

long_description.last_approved_text: If the people are to be saved, and the country to be reclaimed in their name, then we must abandon all sense of being greater, or holier, than the common man. Our shared experience will drive us - we have all suffered under the oppression of corruption together, and only together will we overthrow it.

technologies.long_description: If the people are to be saved, and the country to be reclaimed in their name, then we must abandon all sense of being greater, or holier, than the common man. Our shared experience will drive us - we have all suffered under the oppression of corruption together, and only together will we overthrow it.

short_description.last_approved_text: Abandon your saintliness; put away your prudence; and the people will gain a hundredfold!

technologies.short_description: Abandon your saintliness; put away your prudence; and the people will gain a hundredfold!

long_description.last_approved_text: All strength starts as weakness, just as all armies must begin with a single person, the tallest building must begin with a single brick, and the fight to reclaim China must begin with a single battle. Soon, our numbers will outmatch any strength they can muster, and China will be free.

technologies.long_description: All strength starts as weakness, just as all armies must begin with a single person, the tallest building must begin with a single brick, and the fight to reclaim China must begin with a single battle. Soon, our numbers will outmatch any strength they can muster, and China will be free.

short_description.last_approved_text: The stout tree has originated from a tiny rootlet. A tower of nine stories is raised by heaping up clay.

technologies.short_description: The stout tree has originated from a tiny rootlet. A tower of nine stories is raised by heaping up clay.

long_description.last_approved_text: The quest for greater understanding and to free the people from their shackles will be the quest that saves China. It will root out corruption, be a salve for the sick and a crutch for the weak. The whole realm will grow mighty again once the sickness is finally cut out!

technologies.long_description: The quest for greater understanding and to free the people from their shackles will be the quest that saves China. It will root out corruption, be a salve for the sick and a crutch for the weak. The whole realm will grow mighty again once the sickness is finally cut out!

short_description.last_approved_text: The crooked shall be straight, crushed ones recuperate, the empty find their fill, the worn with strength shall thrill, who have little receive, and who have much will grieve.

technologies.short_description: The crooked shall be straight, crushed ones recuperate, the empty find their fill, the worn with strength shall thrill, who have little receive, and who have much will grieve.

long_description.last_approved_text: We cannot ever truly reach full understanding - like a deep and endless ocean, the Tao will only ever increase in us, never brimming or overwhelming. In this way, in increasing our understanding, will we solve our own problems, and then China's.

technologies.long_description: We cannot ever truly reach full understanding - like a deep and endless ocean, the Tao will only ever increase in us, never brimming or overwhelming. In this way, in increasing our understanding, will we solve our own problems, and then China's.

short_description.last_approved_text: Reason is empty, but its use is inexhaustible. In its profundity, verily, it resembles the father of the ten thousand things. "It will blunt its own sharpness, Will its tangles adjust; It will dim its own radiance. And be one with its dust."

technologies.short_description: Reason is empty, but its use is inexhaustible. In its profundity, verily, it resembles the father of the ten thousand things. "It will blunt its own sharpness, Will its tangles adjust; It will dim its own radiance. And be one with its dust."

long_description.last_approved_text: The reason and understanding of the Tao is the binding agent that holds all things together. It is an ignorance of this understanding and harmony that has led the land into this state of confusion and chaos. Families turn on one another, friends betray friends. Only through a regained understanding of the Tao can the realm be finally redeemed.

technologies.long_description: The reason and understanding of the Tao is the binding agent that holds all things together. It is an ignorance of this understanding and harmony that has led the land into this state of confusion and chaos. Families turn on one another, friends betray friends. Only through a regained understanding of the Tao can the realm be finally redeemed.

short_description.last_approved_text: When relatives are in disharmony, we still have the teachings of filial piety and paternal affection. When the state and the clan are in confusion and disorder, we still have the ideals of loyalty and faithfulness.

technologies.short_description: When relatives are in disharmony, we still have the teachings of filial piety and paternal affection. When the state and the clan are in confusion and disorder, we still have the ideals of loyalty and faithfulness.

long_description.last_approved_text: We should all strive to be free of desire, eschewing material possessions to attain understanding above all else. We should seek to learn that we may help others less learned than ourselves, rather than learning simply to better ourselves alone. For when we improve, so too should all of China.

technologies.long_description: We should all strive to be free of desire, eschewing material possessions to attain understanding above all else. We should seek to learn that we may help others less learned than ourselves, rather than learning simply to better ourselves alone. For when we improve, so too should all of China.

short_description.last_approved_text: The holy man desires to be desireless, and does not prize articles difficult to obtain. He learns, not to be learned, and seeks a home where multitudes of people pass by.

technologies.short_description: The holy man desires to be desireless, and does not prize articles difficult to obtain. He learns, not to be learned, and seeks a home where multitudes of people pass by.

long_description.last_approved_text: When you have studied the Tao, and focused yourself, you free yourself from desire and thus you free yourself from needing to acquire things. In this manner, you may aid others in their development, without ever needing to interfere for your own personal gain.

technologies.long_description: When you have studied the Tao, and focused yourself, you free yourself from desire and thus you free yourself from needing to acquire things. In this manner, you may aid others in their development, without ever needing to interfere for your own personal gain.

short_description.last_approved_text: He assists the ten thousand things in their natural development, but he does not venture to interfere.

technologies.short_description: He assists the ten thousand things in their natural development, but he does not venture to interfere.

long_description.last_approved_text: War should never be desired. The Tao preaches harmony through peace and understanding, but war as a last resort must sometimes be considered. Violence should only be used to overthrow the corrupt, and those who deplore war yet fight it are the righteous ones, destined for victory.

technologies.long_description: War should never be desired. The Tao preaches harmony through peace and understanding, but war as a last resort must sometimes be considered. Violence should only be used to overthrow the corrupt, and those who deplore war yet fight it are the righteous ones, destined for victory.

short_description.last_approved_text: No greater misfortune than making light of the enemy! When we make light of the enemy, it is almost as though we had lost our treasure - compassion.

technologies.short_description: No greater misfortune than making light of the enemy! When we make light of the enemy, it is almost as though we had lost our treasure - compassion.

long_description.last_approved_text: Although a leader is above the people, hierarchically, they do not suffer unjustly from his position. The rivers are called the 'kings of the valley' precisely because they are below the mountains; the people must feel that their leaders, whilst above them, are also servants to their wishes, elsewise a king will be washed away as easily as he arrived.

technologies.long_description: Although a leader is above the people, hierarchically, they do not suffer unjustly from his position. The rivers are called the 'kings of the valley' precisely because they are below the mountains; the people must feel that their leaders, whilst above them, are also servants to their wishes, elsewise a king will be washed away as easily as he arrived.

short_description.last_approved_text: The holy man dwells above, but the people are not burdened. He is ahead, but the people suffer no harm. Therefore the world rejoices in exalting him and does not tire. Because he strives not, no one in the world will strive with him.

technologies.short_description: The holy man dwells above, but the people are not burdened. He is ahead, but the people suffer no harm. Therefore the world rejoices in exalting him and does not tire. Because he strives not, no one in the world will strive with him.

long_description.last_approved_text: Spirit is stronger than matter - this is how we explain how the weak defeat the mighty; physical strength is nothing before the strength of the soul. Persuasion outmatches force almost every time - we must know the value of extremes, and have lived these lives, before we can successfully combat them.

technologies.long_description: Spirit is stronger than matter - this is how we explain how the weak defeat the mighty; physical strength is nothing before the strength of the soul. Persuasion outmatches force almost every time - we must know the value of extremes, and have lived these lives, before we can successfully combat them.

short_description.last_approved_text: That which is about to contract has surely been expanded. That which is about to weaken has surely been strengthened. That which is about to fall has surely been raised. That which is about to be despoiled has surely been endowed. This is an explanation of the secret that the tender and the weak conquer the hard and the strong.

technologies.short_description: That which is about to contract has surely been expanded. That which is about to weaken has surely been strengthened. That which is about to fall has surely been raised. That which is about to be despoiled has surely been endowed. This is an explanation of the secret that the tender and the weak conquer the hard and the strong.

long_description.last_approved_text: With time, everything can be mastered. Self-control allows one to gain mastery over themselves. Through this understanding we can become as innocent as a child, and cleanse our flaws. Then we can look outwards, to cleansing the flaws of our land.

technologies.long_description: With time, everything can be mastered. Self-control allows one to gain mastery over themselves. Through this understanding we can become as innocent as a child, and cleanse our flaws. Then we can look outwards, to cleansing the flaws of our land.

short_description.last_approved_text: Who by unending discipline of the senses embraces unity cannot be disintegrated. By concentrating his vitality and inducing tenderness he can become like a little child. By purifying, by cleansing and profound intuition he can be free from faults.

technologies.short_description: Who by unending discipline of the senses embraces unity cannot be disintegrated. By concentrating his vitality and inducing tenderness he can become like a little child. By purifying, by cleansing and profound intuition he can be free from faults.

long_description.last_approved_text: It is understood that the Tao creates all things; they are formed by the reason and the circumstance of the world around them, but understanding and reason from the Tao nourishes them and helps them to continue - so too with us; we will be protected by the Tao in our quest to free the realm from corruption!

technologies.long_description: It is understood that the Tao creates all things; they are formed by the reason and the circumstance of the world around them, but understanding and reason from the Tao nourishes them and helps them to continue - so too with us; we will be protected by the Tao in our quest to free the realm from corruption!

short_description.last_approved_text: Since the esteem of Reason and the honouring of virtue is commanded by nobody, it is forever spontaneous. Therefore it is said that Reason quickens all creatures, while virtue feeds them, raises them, nurtures them, completes them, matures them, rears them, and protects them.

technologies.short_description: Since the esteem of Reason and the honouring of virtue is commanded by nobody, it is forever spontaneous. Therefore it is said that Reason quickens all creatures, while virtue feeds them, raises them, nurtures them, completes them, matures them, rears them, and protects them.

long_description.last_approved_text: When you manage a settlement, a province, an empire, reason will lead you to success, if you let it. Rumours and superstitions will be as leaves before the wind - the people will pay them no mind, trusting instead in your steadfast rule. The leader who rules responsibly and thoughtfully, not giving in to vice and corruption, will be trusted and adored by the people.

technologies.long_description: When you manage a settlement, a province, an empire, reason will lead you to success, if you let it. Rumours and superstitions will be as leaves before the wind - the people will pay them no mind, trusting instead in your steadfast rule. The leader who rules responsibly and thoughtfully, not giving in to vice and corruption, will be trusted and adored by the people.

short_description.last_approved_text: If with Reason the empire is managed, its ghosts will not spook. Not only will its ghosts not spook, but its gods will not harm the people. Not only will its gods not harm the people, but neither will its holy men harm the people. Since neither will do harm, therefore their virtues will be combined.

technologies.short_description: If with Reason the empire is managed, its ghosts will not spook. Not only will its ghosts not spook, but its gods will not harm the people. Not only will its gods not harm the people, but neither will its holy men harm the people. Since neither will do harm, therefore their virtues will be combined.

long_description.last_approved_text: Peace should always be the ideal we strive towards. To take up arms is a moral terror, and one we should work to avoid. Yet whilst we should always hold peace as the highest ideal, we should not shy away from war to root out the corruption that threatens the people, and the realm.

technologies.long_description: Peace should always be the ideal we strive towards. To take up arms is a moral terror, and one we should work to avoid. Yet whilst we should always hold peace as the highest ideal, we should not shy away from war to root out the corruption that threatens the people, and the realm.

short_description.last_approved_text: Arms are unblest among tools and not the superior man's tools. Only when it is unavoidable he uses them. Peace and quietude he holds high.

technologies.short_description: Arms are unblest among tools and not the superior man's tools. Only when it is unavoidable he uses them. Peace and quietude he holds high.

long_description.last_approved_text: The gift of the silver tongue is the tool of the merchant, the hawker of material goods and worldly pleasures. This is not the Way of Kindness - kindness does not need honeyed words, but honest and generous action. Through this conduct, the people will be better served than by any trinket, and will ultimately be gladder for it.

technologies.long_description: The gift of the silver tongue is the tool of the merchant, the hawker of material goods and worldly pleasures. This is not the Way of Kindness - kindness does not need honeyed words, but honest and generous action. Through this conduct, the people will be better served than by any trinket, and will ultimately be gladder for it.

short_description.last_approved_text: With beautiful words one can sell. With honest conduct one can do still more with the people.

technologies.short_description: With beautiful words one can sell. With honest conduct one can do still more with the people.

long_description.last_approved_text: To be possessed of virtue of spirit is profound and rare; not everyone can be marked by such a trait, and those who are make capable leaders, with far-reaching influence. Often they are looked to as teachers, for even those who do not possess such powerful virtue may still follow, and learn.

technologies.long_description: To be possessed of virtue of spirit is profound and rare; not everyone can be marked by such a trait, and those who are make capable leaders, with far-reaching influence. Often they are looked to as teachers, for even those who do not possess such powerful virtue may still follow, and learn.

short_description.last_approved_text: Spiritual virtue, verily, is profound. Verily, it is far-reaching. Verily, it is to everything reverse. But then it will procure great recognition.

technologies.short_description: Spiritual virtue, verily, is profound. Verily, it is far-reaching. Verily, it is to everything reverse. But then it will procure great recognition.

long_description.last_approved_text: The Tao finds true reason and understanding in the pragmatic and not the ostentatious - the fruit of the matter, that gives life and sustenance, rather than the flower, which delights only the senses with smell and colour. Such things should be discarded, as frivolities bring nothing but distraction.

technologies.long_description: The Tao finds true reason and understanding in the pragmatic and not the ostentatious - the fruit of the matter, that gives life and sustenance, rather than the flower, which delights only the senses with smell and colour. Such things should be discarded, as frivolities bring nothing but distraction.

short_description.last_approved_text: A great organizer abides by the solid and dwells not in the external. He abides in the fruit and dwells not in the flower. Therefore he discards the latter and chooses the former.

technologies.short_description: A great organizer abides by the solid and dwells not in the external. He abides in the fruit and dwells not in the flower. Therefore he discards the latter and chooses the former.

long_description.last_approved_text: The sooner one begins practicing and studying the Tao, expending effort in the attempt, then the more virtuous being of reason they will become. When one has studied hard and applied oneself entirely to the acquisition of reason, then there is nothing beyond their power.

technologies.long_description: The sooner one begins practicing and studying the Tao, expending effort in the attempt, then the more virtuous being of reason they will become. When one has studied hard and applied oneself entirely to the acquisition of reason, then there is nothing beyond their power.

short_description.last_approved_text: By early practice it is said that we can accumulate an abundance of virtue. If one accumulates an abundance of virtue then there is nothing that can not be overcome.

technologies.short_description: By early practice it is said that we can accumulate an abundance of virtue. If one accumulates an abundance of virtue then there is nothing that can not be overcome.

long_description.last_approved_text: It sounds counterproductive to suggest that keeping the people uneducated would lead to their betterment, but the Tao seeks to keep all people simple of spirit and purpose. It will remove from them guile and greed and corruption, that they may live and lead a more simple, blessed life, and so may also rule in a similar manner.

technologies.long_description: It sounds counterproductive to suggest that keeping the people uneducated would lead to their betterment, but the Tao seeks to keep all people simple of spirit and purpose. It will remove from them guile and greed and corruption, that they may live and lead a more simple, blessed life, and so may also rule in a similar manner.

short_description.last_approved_text: The ancients who were well versed in Reason did not thereby enlighten the people; they intended thereby to make them simple-hearted.

technologies.short_description: The ancients who were well versed in Reason did not thereby enlighten the people; they intended thereby to make them simple-hearted.

long_description.last_approved_text: By hoarding what is rare, or overly celebrating what is difficult, do you cultivate jealousy, rivalry and theft. Only through promoting simplicity, reducing ambition and combating physical desires will the reasoned ruler know peace in his lands. Keep the people happy by removing stimulus that may cause them to contemplate vice and they will flourish.

technologies.long_description: By hoarding what is rare, or overly celebrating what is difficult, do you cultivate jealousy, rivalry and theft. Only through promoting simplicity, reducing ambition and combating physical desires will the reasoned ruler know peace in his lands. Keep the people happy by removing stimulus that may cause them to contemplate vice and they will flourish.

short_description.last_approved_text: The holy man when he governs empties the people's hearts but fills their stomachs. He weakens their ambition but strengthens their bones. Always he keeps the people unsophisticated and without desire. He causes that the crafty do not dare to act. When he acts with non-assertion there is nothing ungoverned.

technologies.short_description: The holy man when he governs empties the people's hearts but fills their stomachs. He weakens their ambition but strengthens their bones. Always he keeps the people unsophisticated and without desire. He causes that the crafty do not dare to act. When he acts with non-assertion there is nothing ungoverned.

short_description.last_approved_text: Da Qin - those peoples beyond China's borders - are purveyors of wealth and knowledge if we have but the patience to listen. \n\n The Silk Road carries foreign envoys back from distant lands, and with them comes enlightenment.

technologies.short_description: Da Qin - those peoples beyond China's borders - are purveyors of wealth and knowledge if we have but the patience to listen. \n\n The Silk Road carries foreign envoys back from distant lands, and with them comes enlightenment.

short_description.last_approved_text: The Qiaoren - 'lodged people' - are those who have abandoned their rural homes and migrated to urban centres in search of a better life. \n\n Those who have moved in search of employment can therefore be relied upon to be efficient - and determined - workers.

technologies.short_description: The Qiaoren - 'lodged people' - are those who have abandoned their rural homes and migrated to urban centres in search of a better life. \n\n Those who have moved in search of employment can therefore be relied upon to be efficient - and determined - workers.

short_description.last_approved_text: True enlightenment comes not only from inward focus, but also outward generosity and thoughtfulness towards others. \n\n A pure gift, given with pure intentions to a pure recipient, is the very essence of generosity.

technologies.short_description: True enlightenment comes not only from inward focus, but also outward generosity and thoughtfulness towards others. \n\n A pure gift, given with pure intentions to a pure recipient, is the very essence of generosity.

short_description.last_approved_text: Through the spiritual we gain enlightenment. Through the physical we gain power. Through both we gain life eternal. \n\n By studying 'Neidan', we unify our essence, our breath and our spirit into one, pure, unified Tao, and thus gain spiritual immortality.

technologies.short_description: Through the spiritual we gain enlightenment. Through the physical we gain power. Through both we gain life eternal. \n\n By studying 'Neidan', we unify our essence, our breath and our spirit into one, pure, unified Tao, and thus gain spiritual immortality.

short_description.last_approved_text: The market cannot be allowed to operate unchecked lest China fall entirely into the hands of enterprising merchants. \n\n In every city, the markets are watched and regulated by deputies who ensure all is balanced and fair.

technologies.short_description: The market cannot be allowed to operate unchecked lest China fall entirely into the hands of enterprising merchants. \n\n In every city, the markets are watched and regulated by deputies who ensure all is balanced and fair.

short_description.last_approved_text: What is written down is real; what is written down is law. \n\n 'Hukou', a comprehensive list of each citizen's life, forms the basis of government records, determining taxes and conscription across the entire empire.

technologies.short_description: What is written down is real; what is written down is law. \n\n 'Hukou', a comprehensive list of each citizen's life, forms the basis of government records, determining taxes and conscription across the entire empire.

short_description.last_approved_text: For a war to be won, it must be supported. Every battle must be fought with weapons and armour as much as men. \n\n Without these things, an army is no more than a mob, and a mob is swiftly put down.

technologies.short_description: For a war to be won, it must be supported. Every battle must be fought with weapons and armour as much as men. \n\n Without these things, an army is no more than a mob, and a mob is swiftly put down.

short_description.last_approved_text: The canon of Buddhism - the Dàzàngjīng - is said to be the interpreted words of Buddha himself. \n\n Although broad in their teachings, it generally advises seeking merit and perfection through study, wisdom, and compassion.

technologies.short_description: The canon of Buddhism - the Dàzàngjīng - is said to be the interpreted words of Buddha himself. \n\n Although broad in their teachings, it generally advises seeking merit and perfection through study, wisdom, and compassion.

short_description.last_approved_text: To offer up sacrifice to the spirits is a central tenet of Taoism. \n\n Although Zhang Daoling aggressively forbade the sacrifice of food and animals, the practice of burning 'hell money' is still encouraged, as a way of honouring departed ancestors.

technologies.short_description: To offer up sacrifice to the spirits is a central tenet of Taoism. \n\n Although Zhang Daoling aggressively forbade the sacrifice of food and animals, the practice of burning 'hell money' is still encouraged, as a way of honouring departed ancestors.

short_description.last_approved_text: The emperor steps back from the business of direct governance, letting officials and bureaucrats anticipate his will. \n\n In this way, he hopes to stay free of corruption, and trusts that his chosen administrators will too…

technologies.short_description: The emperor steps back from the business of direct governance, letting officials and bureaucrats anticipate his will. \n\n In this way, he hopes to stay free of corruption, and trusts that his chosen administrators will too…

short_description.last_approved_text: Balance is a constant process; too much power in one place will cause it to precariously shift. \n\n Much like the Han, it is Jin practice to regulate markets as and when required - even establishing monopolies to keep merchants in line.

technologies.short_description: Balance is a constant process; too much power in one place will cause it to precariously shift. \n\n Much like the Han, it is Jin practice to regulate markets as and when required - even establishing monopolies to keep merchants in line.

short_description.last_approved_text: To control a populace, you must first fully know and understand them. \n\n The Hukou system documents the status of every citizen - their name, their family, and their date of birth; all the information required to judge, then appropriately tax, everybody.

technologies.short_description: To control a populace, you must first fully know and understand them. \n\n The Hukou system documents the status of every citizen - their name, their family, and their date of birth; all the information required to judge, then appropriately tax, everybody.

short_description.last_approved_text: It is the core of Buddhism to observe and improve in order to liberate. \n\n To ponder the metaphysical too much is to invite too much speculation, and stray too far from the ideas that will ultimately awaken us.

technologies.short_description: It is the core of Buddhism to observe and improve in order to liberate. \n\n To ponder the metaphysical too much is to invite too much speculation, and stray too far from the ideas that will ultimately awaken us.

short_description.last_approved_text: Through mastery of the alchemical arts and the focusing of the spirit, we may discover the path to enlightenment, and thus immortality. \n\n Such is the way of Taoist alchemy, which seeks to harmonise the physical and the spiritual to unlocks the way to awakening.

technologies.short_description: Through mastery of the alchemical arts and the focusing of the spirit, we may discover the path to enlightenment, and thus immortality. \n\n Such is the way of Taoist alchemy, which seeks to harmonise the physical and the spiritual to unlocks the way to awakening.

short_description.last_approved_text: Valuable trade routes and vital highways span the length and breadth of the empire; they must be defended. \n\n Avaricious bandits and audacious brigands seek opportunity and riches wherever they can. Defence posts are raised to protect imperial assets from these threats.

technologies.short_description: Valuable trade routes and vital highways span the length and breadth of the empire; they must be defended. \n\n Avaricious bandits and audacious brigands seek opportunity and riches wherever they can. Defence posts are raised to protect imperial assets from these threats.

short_description.last_approved_text: With his authority established, the warlord's decrees echo across the vastness of the realm. \n\n As power and legitimacy grow, loyalty grows with it; warriors and citizens work harder and more efficiently for a leader they respect.

technologies.short_description: With his authority established, the warlord's decrees echo across the vastness of the realm. \n\n As power and legitimacy grow, loyalty grows with it; warriors and citizens work harder and more efficiently for a leader they respect.

short_description.last_approved_text: To focus on unity - understanding both ourselves and the world around us - is to live in harmony. \n\n The progress of society is intrinsically linked to this frictionless co-existence, drawing us ever closer to spiritual perfection.

technologies.short_description: To focus on unity - understanding both ourselves and the world around us - is to live in harmony. \n\n The progress of society is intrinsically linked to this frictionless co-existence, drawing us ever closer to spiritual perfection.

short_description.last_approved_text: No army can march indefinitely, yet the well-supplied and well-prepared force will outpace - and outfight - lesser adversaries. \n\n The land provides for those seeking sustenance; raiding, as much as any prepared supplies, will sustain an army.

technologies.short_description: No army can march indefinitely, yet the well-supplied and well-prepared force will outpace - and outfight - lesser adversaries. \n\n The land provides for those seeking sustenance; raiding, as much as any prepared supplies, will sustain an army.

short_description.last_approved_text: A family of soldiers, serving for life, can be relied upon to be loyal and disciplined no matter the odds. \n\n It was Cao Cao who, many years ago, stratified the military 'buqu' - hereditary troops - into full military households, and in so doing guaranteed their dedication.

technologies.short_description: A family of soldiers, serving for life, can be relied upon to be loyal and disciplined no matter the odds. \n\n It was Cao Cao who, many years ago, stratified the military 'buqu' - hereditary troops - into full military households, and in so doing guaranteed their dedication.

short_description.last_approved_text: When war is all-consuming, there is a macabre wisdom in leaving no stone - and no body - unturned. \n\n As the land gives back to the foragers, so too does the battle, once over, give back to the victors.

technologies.short_description: When war is all-consuming, there is a macabre wisdom in leaving no stone - and no body - unturned. \n\n As the land gives back to the foragers, so too does the battle, once over, give back to the victors.

short_description.last_approved_text: For those who fall in the service of their lord, the battlefield need not be their grave. \n\n The work of the renowned Hua Tuo produced myriad poultices and methods (like acupuncture) to aid recovery, for both the common man and warrior alike.

technologies.short_description: For those who fall in the service of their lord, the battlefield need not be their grave. \n\n The work of the renowned Hua Tuo produced myriad poultices and methods (like acupuncture) to aid recovery, for both the common man and warrior alike.

short_description.last_approved_text: When war looms, a lord calls his people and they must answer. \n\n Vested power by the state to levy armies, local leaders summon all able-bodied men to fight when conflict consumes the land.

technologies.short_description: When war looms, a lord calls his people and they must answer. \n\n Vested power by the state to levy armies, local leaders summon all able-bodied men to fight when conflict consumes the land.
